Summary: Very quaint, quiet and clean.  Excellent room at a very good price.  Parking was great and close to the room.  I came in late and they had the room all ready and warmed up.  Reasonably close to the Pier which was my reason for staying here.

It was a great stay! My husband and I stayed 3 nights. We were torn between here and a different hotel (where my other family was staying) and I am so glad we chose to stay here instead. Comparing our experiences we definitely made the right choice staying here. We had a late check-in (after hours) and they made accommodations for us but make sure if it‚Äôs a late check-in you call! The bed was very comfortable, sheets were soft, pillows were nice, clean and came with extra blankets in the dresser. We booked a small room as we knew we wouldn‚Äôt be spending much time in it and it was perfect size for 2. It was a cute little set up with a small table and 2 chairs and included a mini fridge which was great. The front desk lady was very friendly, polite and helpful. The location was
Room tip: Parking lot is smaller, there is free parking on the street, handicapped upfront and the suite...

Summary Heading: Better Than Expected. We'll Be Back!
Summary: We absolutely loved staying in their suite. The home-like atmosphere included a kitchen with dishes, silverware, pots, pans, condiments, micro, fridge. Decorator accents were throughout the suite. We had an unobstructed view of the ocean where we watched the sun set every evening from our dining room as well as on our private fenced in patio complete with a BBQ grill, fire pit and patio table and chairs. Very close to all things San Clemente. Ralph's is just a half block away for last minute food items and spirits.
Room tip: You won't be disappointed. It is conveniently located to everything in San Clemente and just a...

Summary: had a great trip to San Clemente and our stay at Patriots Motel; walked to breakfast, lunch and to dinner on Del Mar Ave which is right up the street, best location out of all the hotels in san clemente.  nice decor and friendly staff.

Summary Heading: I really wanted to like it, BUT...
Summary: The door locks are unsecured and look like they've been kicked in a few times and could be accessed with a credit card.  They have limited parking so i had to park my truck loaded with gear on the unlit street and literally stepped in a puddle if human urine when i got out of it.  The urine part isn't their fault I suppose. I saw multiple different types of bugs in the room, no a/c, and had to call and wake someone up in the morning when I accidentally locked myself out.  I really wanted to like the place initially because the employees seem very nice.  Sorry, I'm not your surf buddy, I'm a paying client that doesn't like to worry about my truck, door lock and bugs when I sleep.  They clearly invest more in the plants around the property (the boutique part i guess) than security

Summary Heading: Very nice older motel for a reasonable price
Summary: This is such a cute older motel, we had 2 rooms and both were large, very comfortable beds, super clean, and the motel manager is very kind and keeps the outside looking pretty.  Conveniences like shampoo and hair dryer were still provided and our A/C units worked just fine (even in July didn't really need much A/C due to the beautiful weather).  The parking is free and did accomadate regular size trucks/vans/SUVs but smaller vehicles were easier.  There is a fresh made bagel/coffee shop right next door and Antoine's restaurant a short 3 minute walk (yummy and big full breakfasts).  We drove down to the pier twice and surprisingly had no trouble with parking.  Best of all, this is less than 5 minute drive from Camp Pendleton North Gate!!  If you need fancy and modern, this place

Summary Heading: Could be so much better for so little...
Summary: We're there every 5 weeks or so, this we booked within 4 days so beggars can't be choosers...never truer words have been spoken.  The Good - Location is awesome, you've got several food options within a half mile, either beach is within 2 miles.  Parking is a breeze, pillows good, mattress okay.  The Bad - It's a motel but that's not just it.  Most of my gripes are more structural than not but, how about a clean lamp shade, not too sure who's been coughing on the one in room 15.  Also, they tried at one point to fix the shower valve, it didn't work.  Shower is either boiling lava hot, or meet freezer cold.  The toilet is from the 50's and more suitable for someone under 5'5".  Maybe not place the fridge/freezer combo on an unstable table.  Provide hangers if you're going to

Very simple, plain and clean older MOTEL. Lady in office was super nice. There is parking on site,coffee shop next door and decent taco shop across street. Beds are not comfortable, price for our Sunday night stay was on point. Saturday night we overpaid!

Another great trip to the Patriots Motel with the family. The kids love being able to walk to shopping and restaurants and the chill zone with grill and games is perfect for our clan. Thanks Kate and Tony for such an awesome place to visit!

review in depth coming. buyer beware for spring break. pay 10 dollars more for real service, thicker walls, and amenities. There is a fire pit, but its janky and no wood is provided and staff is annoyed when you need service of anykind.

Summary Heading: Tons of charm, nestled in the heart of San Clemente
Summary: I‚Äôm not typically one to leave reviews but this time I cannot say enough.   We remember our stay at Patriots‚Äô in the best possible way. We were in town for a Military Funeral- a somber time to say the least. Despite the circumstances Patriots‚Äô was the perfect place to unwind, reflect and become acquainted with a true gem of Southern California, San Clemente.   From  the moment we checked in the homey atmosphere of the quaint motel welcomed us in a way larger chains cannot replicate. Like a nod to simpler times, Patriots Motel presented an invitation to enjoy quality time together. All the standard ‚Äúcheck boxes‚Äù Of a pleasant place to rest your head while away from home were met and surpassed.    Our room was spacious & clean, bed & linens super comfy. Management & staff were

Summary Heading: Misleading Shoddy Avoid unless you are desperate
Summary: Staying here validated all the reasons why no longer stay at hotels or motels. The king size bed we stayed in (Room number 2) was like sleeping on a marshmallow. The plumbing in the shower was backwards meaning hot water tap on cold water side and vice versa. Be careful you don‚Äôt scald yourself or freeze. The toilet seat is extremely low to the ground so only if you‚Äôre 8 years old will it be attenable. The TV set has c√¢ble but it seems to be set to only one channel that you cannot see. What‚Äôs up with that? But the kicker was the $50.00 pet fee that we were lead to believe meant we could leave our well behaved doggie in the room while we attended a wedding in Dana Point taking place in a restaurant. Well as far as we know the health department doesn‚Äôt allow dogs in restaurants.

I am surprised at some of the low star reviews because I have nothing but good things to say about my stay at the Patriots Boutique Motel. First of all, this showed as a 2 star property when I booked on orbitz so you can‚Äôt have 5 star expectations on a 2 star property. That being said, this place outdid my expectations. Check in was a breeze and the lady who checked us in couldn‚Äôt have been nicer. She even gave us the option to look at 2 different rooms available because we were traveling with a little guy and a bit concerned with the street noise. We ended up in room 6 with 2 double beds and a spacious bathroom with large stall shower. This is an old motel but they did a nice job of updating and modernizing. The beds were super comfy with great linens and there was a

Stayed here 2 nights and paid $125 per night, was summer so other chains nearby were even higher and/or their reviews were a real mixed bag. This motel could be super cute with some good elbow grease, but seems it is run as cheaply as possible. Be aware at check in you pay for your stay IN FULL, and they still use a regular metal key for all rooms, not the safest thing to do in SoCal.  Our room "appeared" clean, good bed, the usual. The bathroom had a less clean apearance, towels had an odor as if they had been previously moist too long and not washed with bleach, very rusty toilet paper dispenser, moldy caulking around the window and shower unit, things cheap and easy to fix but they don't bother with. In the room the best part was the mis-matched stack of table, fridge, and

Good location, as we were able to walk to our restaurants both days and there was also a Starbucks right down the street. Close to the beach. There ends the good.   Parking is terrible. If you happen to arrive later in the day you will have to park on the very busy street as there are only fourteen spaces for a sixteen room inn. Property is old but has a bit of charm.   Our room was reasonably clean but there were empty boxes sitting in the bathroom and there was a portable air conditioning unit in the middle of the room. It was a hot time of year so it wasn‚Äôt the best.   The bed was very lumpy and the springs were shot. Had a problem with the older flat screen that ended up needing to be reset.   While packing up to leave I notice mouse droppings inside my pillow box which I

This motel is in a great location a few blocks from Del Mar street the hub of San Clemente. It is very clean and staff was friendly. Just don't get room 1, bathroom used for storage and some portable unattractive a/c unit sitting in the bathroom (see pictures).King bed's innerspring mattress was very hard and a futon couch sat in bedroom with a cover over it definitely not boutique. Price was good for San Clemente just avoid room 1.

We had a great stay. Super friendly and inviting staff. Very accommodating to our group who had some special needs. Would absolutely stay again! Great location close to great nightlife and awesome food and drink.

We stayed here in 2015 and were so excited to comeback to this boutique hotel! Sadly we were disappointed. Room was really dirty, so dirty that after you shower and walk around the room barefoot your feet turn black! There was also a janitors or maintenance closet in our room which had a bit of an odour. Lastly, I asked for a roll of toilet paper on our last morning and the lady looked at me strange and stated that she gave me a roll the day prior and asked how could i Possibly go through a roll that fast. I advised her there was 2 of us. She then rolled her eyes and got a half full roll from another room telling me this was all she could spare. It‚Äôs a small detail but it was disappointing to have such a positive experience back in 2015 and then such a poor experience in 2018.

I loved this motel!! It's older, but they have done some really great things with it to make it cute and charming. The front desk woman (who might be the owner) was so kind and patient, and really made you feel welcomed. It's in a great location, really close to a grocery store. It isn't big and fancy, it's small and quaint. If you like staying at non-hotel chains, you have to go here!

This is not a resort but a very clean hotel. The price and the location was great! Not even five minutes from the highway and about ten minutes from the beach. Very friendly staff with a lot of information to give. It was my first time there but two of the other guests were returning visitors. I will definitely be back!

We stayed at the Patriot for several nights in mid July 2018.It is really a gem. It's not expensive and the rooms are big and updated. The bathroom was big and nice. the only problem was the shower curtain doesn't keep the water in and the water on the bathmat seems to sour over the day. Otherwise, we found the motel to be nice. Picnic tables out back were nice and we used them. The manager is great and very helpful to visitors. I would definitely stay here again if I visit San Clemente. The location is perfect to just about everything we wanted to do.

If you want something that isn't too expensive less then a mile from the pier this is a good choice. The owners were very accommodating. No coffee in rooms though but a little fridge and microwave. They let us check in a couple hours early and the room was clean but yes very old hotel. Hole in the wall, nice owners, great location, but don't expect new anything or any frills.

I came to see my son at Camp Pendleton. The location was perfect. I was only a few exits down from Base and was able to walk to the beach from hotel. We also could walk to eating places and grocery store. Staff was friendly and room was clean. Enjoyed it all.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Basic room. Beds were fine. Some lights didn't work. Lesser level of fit and finish.we didn't experience noise problems. Shower temp controls were hard to manage. For what you pay compared to others, this is what you should expect.

This hotel is nice and the woman who checked us in if very friendly!  The noise level at night is awful!  It's 1am and each time I try to fall asleep another person either yells or slams a door shut.  People yell and slam doors as if no one else exists!!!  This is the most disappointing night in a hotel I have ever  had.  This is unbelievable.  I never usually write reviews I did this time because if you stay here do not expect to be able to sleep!

We were so stoked to find a place that has a family owned and operated vibe rather than the status quo corporate hotel/motel chains. They take great care of the property and the staff is extremely warm, welcoming, and attentive to all of the guests. The location is walking distance to several restaurants, 24/hr Mexican food and neighboring Bagel Shack. If your looking to dine in and relax the grocery store is less than a block away. For avid watermen and surfers the location is perfect for quick access to all of the beaches and breaks without the need of freeway. Truthfully, it doesn‚Äôt matter what brings you to San Clemente... The Patriot is a perfect place to relax and recharge whether you‚Äôre staying for a night or a week!

Summary Heading: Great customer service and easy to get around
Summary: The management of this boutique motel is the best part. Everyone (including the other guests) is friendly and helpful and very accommodating.  I didn't have a car so the location next to the Bagel Shack and Ralph's for groceries was ideal.  Short walk to the beach and access to bike trail.  Clean and comfy room with a nice space to get my work done. And the price is right for a teacher on sabbatical!

Summary Heading: Very charming hotel if you are not looking for frills. Just a nice place to chill.
Summary: Because our anniversary is at the end of the month, the husband and I were a little short of funds but we still wanted a nice little weekend getaway. This hotel is perfect for that.  It might not be super close to the ocean, but it is a good little walk to shopping and restaurants and yes, even the ocean.  The rooms were clean and very nicely decorated. They had old school a/c and shutters on the windows, but that was ok because it worked. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a nice size! There is no room service or pool and the walls might be a tad on the thin side, but it does the job. We had a very nice stay here! Next time we may bring our dog since this place is also dog friendly!

Visiting Dana Point area in August, I shouldn't expect to find an affordable room, however, we took a chance on The Patriots Boutique Motel.  We had high hopes for a charming seaside motel, but I am afraid we got our latest laugh out loud adventure... whether it was the missing peephole, leaving a hole in our door,  or the need to leave our window with the jimmied screen open all night to the sounds of motorcycles and trucks on PCH ....or perhaps the hole in the bathroom ceiling, my husband, daughter and I kept looking over our shoulder for Mrs Bates.         After suffering through a spitty shower with a leaky handheld spout, I hopped on the bed only to have the one light go out.  My husband and I laughed and laughed as we bounced the room into a disco show due to the bed

We wanted to get away for a few days and booked the Patriot based on reviews. We did not have high expectations, just wanted a basic room at an affordable price. We were satisfied. The man in the office was friendly. The motel is a 1950s motor lodge, located on the main drag, walking distance to shops, restaurant, and the pier/beach. We basically parked in their lot and never drove again over two days. The room was spacious, the bathroom huge. A foldout bed could be placed in the bathroom, clear of the shower, sink and toilet, though I don't know that I'd do that. Another fold out bed could be placed in the room despite the king bed. There is a mini fridge and microwave, and a TV with cable. I found the WiFi sorely lacking, and just gave up. The room was clean, though dated, and

This hotel is in such a great central location. You can walk to downtown easily, the grocery store and to several great nearby eateries.  The rooms are pretty nice and updated with a nice modern look. I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Super Quaint and Close to Everything
Summary: I cannot give the Patriots Boutique Motel a high enough recommendation. The room I stayed in was super updated with beautiful hardwood floors, a flatscreen TV and incredibly comfortable sheets. The staff was friendly and outgoing, I just felt comfortable there.  Here's the best part - It's close to everything! I was there surfing and I was minutes away from Trestles and some of the most infamous SoCal surf breaks.   I would recommend the Patriot's Boutique Motel to anyone, and I plan on going back.

We stayed here for a week and really appreciated the location and the good size of the rooms and the bathrooms. Bed was comfy and the room was cozy and clean. Would definitely recommend this spot for anyone visiting San Clemente.

Summary Heading: Family Run Business - The Success of America
Summary: This is one of the hidden gems of San Clemente, might as well say Southern California. It is a beautiful location right in the center of SC, it has great options for food, shopping and groceries near by. The hotel has been renovated and each room has its own special twist. Make sure to plan a fire at the Hotel's Fire pit! Sit down, relax and watch the stars from the chairs around the fire pit.   This place rocks, come for the surf, sleep well and know that you are a supporting a family run business. Hands down the best secret to share with your friends.

Summary Heading: Great Motel, Great Staff. Will come back
Summary: I came to The Patriots Motel for a week long surf trip. I was extremely satisfied with everything about this motel. The room were extremely clean with comfortable beds and a nice layout. Every room that our group had rented out had its own cool and unique style to it. The group of ten i was with took advantage of all the dining and shopping within walking distance as well as the fireplace that is provided. If you are looking for somewhere to stay in San Clemente i would highly recommend The Patriots Motel.

Stayed with a group of friends this past week.  The rooms were good size, clean with surprisingly big bathroom.  The staff was super courteous and pro-active to any needs we might have had.  We'll definitely be coming back!

I stayed at this boutique with my boyfriend and some friends and it was very nice. The rooms are extremely roomy and a great size so one doesn't feel claustrophobic.  An all around great spot to be when visiting San Clemente.

They took awesome care of me and my friends for our stay in San Clemente. Beds are comfy,  rooms are clean and location is great. You're just a quick few steps away the main street with lots of shops and restaurants, and also just up hill from the ocean.

I wish I could rate this place with 0 Stars!!!!! It's the most dirtiest place I've ever stayed in!!!. EXTREMELY DUSTY!!!, carpet is so old with lots of stains on it!!! But the Worst part is that Stinks!!! So gross!!! My husband got really sick thanks to the layers of dust in our room and my body was itching the whole time also! This place is garbage. CAN'T BELIEVE  this place passed Inspections!!! HOW?!!!!! Well I don't recommend this place At All!!!! Do not stay here, Do not Waste your money!!!

My daughter and I just needed a getaway in celebration of my upcoming birthday. The room's ambiance was quite Quaint. Our room was just outside the cute patio with a fire pit and a barbecue grill. We're planning to return in the summer.

I originally booked this motel sight unseen because I needed a place close to my daughter's house in San Clemente.  When I first drove up, I silently thought "Oh Oh!"  I as pleasantly surprised when I got into the room.  It has a 1930's 1940's charm.  Slight on amenities but very clean and comfortable.  The bed was perfect for me!  The bathroom could be another bedroom, LOL!  Like I said, it did not have any of the big hotel amenities, but when you are in San Clemente, how much time are you planning on staying in the room?  I would definitely stay here again!

"Boutique" hotel, definitely not. Booked this motel based on the reviews, what a big mistake. The place was dirty with bugs on the floor (probably coming from the holes in the wall under the sink) Dog from another room barked all through the night. Slept with my clothes on on top of the bed and got up early to leave.  San Clemente is such a beautiful place especially down by the pier,, well worth a visit but stay somewhere else.

Loved staying here while visiting our daughter who lives in Dan Clemente. Very clean and comfortable with a refrigerator and microwave ~ close to shops, beach and restaurants. Fire pit and BBQ available. Will definitely come back!

Summary Heading: A Decent Place at a Decent Price
Summary: I stayed here for a couple of days while visiting family in San Clemente.  This is an older small motel so it is less expensive than the newer and larger franchises in the area.  Less expensive is relative.  I'm from out of state and the rate was easily twice to three times as much as a place in this category would cost in other states not on a coast.  But, it was still half the cost of say, a Holiday Inn.  As I mentioned it is older so the rooms are larger than new motels.  My room was clean and just fine for what I needed.  The light over the bathroom sink didn't work but there was overhead lighting and windows in the bathroom so lighting was not a factor.  The shower was large as was the bathroom and bedroom.  Quaint comes to mind.  The staff was pleasant and probably the

Just passing through? This will suffice. Looking for a quick getaway on a strict budget? This will suffice. No frills (like no soap in the bathroom no frills), old squeaky bed, outdated (but functional) wall AC unit. But it was quiet, which was surprising given it's proximity to the freeway. Or maybe the loud AC unit drowned out the freeway noise, not sure. Either way, it was a quick walk to great restaurants, cute shops, and lively nightlife. Overall I didnt expect much of this motel, therefore I wasn't disapointed. Its worth staying here to visit San Clemente- great little beach community.

Lovely little place, quite quirky. Very clean and some nice furnishing touches Our room had 2 Queen beds and large bathroom with great shower. Beautifully comfortable bed and pillows, lovely linen and soft towels No ice machine but an outside space for sitting and a bbq was nice feature. Uber was only $4 to San Clemente Pier ( too hot to walk) Good value for money

Who would have thunk it? As someone used to chain hotels, I was hesitant about booking a "boutique motel", but the price and location were right.  Boy, was I surprised! The Patriots is a wonderful little gem of a place.  Family owned and operated, it appears as what it was, a 1950s or 1960s motor Inn.  However, strategic upgrades have turned it into a great place to stay.  Could it use a little more improvement? Sure...the bathrooms need to be upgraded a bit, and the closet in our room (#16) probably needs to be rebuilt, but the beds were comfortable, the shower was hot, and the location was perfect.  We WILL stay there again as we are often in San Clemente...(and make sure to eat at the Bagel Shack next door....)

Stayed with Patriots last weekend, what a nice surprise for the price point of this property. Big up to Kate for helping us secure a third room for an extra night at the last possible moment, incredible customer service. Julie our housekeeper took very good care of us. Ample parking for the area, older property but kept very nice. Big rooms, huge bathroom, our beds were very nice and comfortable. We loved it and would not hesitate to stay there again. We were not bothered by noise what so ever, easy walking distance to several eateries and bars, and shops. Microwave and fridge in all of our rooms. Not too bad of walk to beach and pier, we LOVED San Clemente. Nice lil 24/7 Mexican restaurant across street, cheap and good. Thanks for a wonderful short stay.  Mike & Beth

Love this place, love staff and room is consistently clean and comfortable.  We walk to beaches and restaurants each visit and enjoy the fireplace and bbq.  Have stayed at their Florida hotel too and same great experience.  Have stayed at every hotel in San Clemente and now only go here

Summary Heading: Nice value for those on a budget
Summary: Stayed here with a friend on an overnite trip. Very cute, retro motel, Spanish-style & nicely maintained. Two negatives, it is noisy being below the I-5 fwy but if you close the windows it's better. Also found a dead roach in shower. Mgrs said they had just sprayed. :/ Positives are its economical, close to center of town and a short mile walk to beach!  Coffee is served but no continental breakfast is provided; however, there are plenty of eateries nearby. Our neighbor, a German man and teen son (on tour of national parks & western USA) seemed happy with the place!

Summary Heading: Old. dilapidated hotel with no staff on a major noisy road and car park- not even worth $20 a nite.
Summary: old hotel, fixtures in the bathroom and bathroom itself from the 50's even though they calim to have remodeled. heater from the 50's blowing directly on the beds- would never stay there again and definitely a ripoff at $2000usd a nite,
Manager Response: Hi Eni, we are sorry that you were not satisfied with your stay with us.  We do work hard to keep up with the property and to offer the guest a comfortable experience.  The majority of our guests are very happy, as you can see from our reviews, but we are sorry you are not one of them.    - Manny

Summary: From the outside the motel looks pretty nice and renovated. When checking in the welcome was very friendly. The room itself was rather disappointing, even if the tv and the floor were new. Air conditioning was not in the room itself, but in the bathroom. The bathroom was huge, but it was used as storage for not used a/cs and beds. The walls could use fresh paint, and everything could be a bit cleaner. It's okay for one night, but we did not really feel comfortable.

We stayed here during our move to the area while we were finding a place to live. It was one of the only places that seemed to allow pets in town and the location is fabulous. So many great restaurants in walking distance. The Bagel Shack next door is GREAT, there is a Ralph's just a short walk away, and a great 24 hour Mexican restaurant across the street (Adolfo's). The rooms themselves weren't "amazing", but the did the job especially for the price. The staff is so friendly and very helpful.

Family came to San Clemente for the first time this year and had a wonderful experience, and in big part because of the hotel we picked.   Patriots Boutique is a family run business with the most pleasant, helpful and kind staff.  The two rooms we booked were well decorated and both had large king beds and flat screen tvs.  Internet was strong, rooms were very clean, common area gardens and their yard next door were well cared for and had a fire place, picnic tables and umbrellas for a comfortable outdoor space to lounge.  They had the best reviews in town which is why we picked them and I'm happy to submit this review to validate the others.

Summary Heading: Affordable with great staff in the perfect location.
Summary: At first I was quite weary about staying in the Patriots Boutique Motel but after my first two nights I realized how great this place was. Not only is the staff very nice, but the location is near everything. Did I mention the price? its very affordable for what you are getting. The internet is great, the bathroom is an amazing size and whatever information you need about the town the manager seems to know it all. I would highly recommend you stay here if visiting San Clemente.   Though there is no contential breakfast, there is one of the best bagel shops right next to it as well as a 24 hour good mexican food restaurant. If you feel like relaxing and having a bbq, there are a few bbq's out in the courtyard which is quite big and relaxing.  Like I said, this is a great place to

If you are looking for a nice convenient place to stay for a visit in San Clemente, without paying an arm and a leg this is the place. There is no pool, room service or many other amenities, but the rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable and it has a fridge, microwave and an HD TV with many channels.

This family run business is now one of my favorite little hotels.  The building has such character and the rooms are warm and cozy and so cute.  The family that runs this property are all from the east coast and are so down to earth and genuine.  The location was also very convenient, walking distance to the shops and restaurants in downtown.  Love the whole experience and I'm sure you will too.

Spent one night here with a friend. We stayed in Room 6 which was clean, had no carpet (which I like) and pretty spacious. Bed was okay, but the pillows were pretty crappy. Bedding was clean and warm and comfortable. Room includes a flat screen TV and a small fridge.    We chose this motel for the location because we were spending most of our time in San Clemente and on Avenida Del Mar. It's a short drive/walk to all the local areas, shops, restaurants and beaches and right on Camino Real which is the Main Street that runs through San Clemente.   Before you choose to stay here, you must be okay with the motel style rooms. Walls are thin and if you're okay with hearing your neighbors conversations, TV late into the night, and other interesting noises (yeah...heard that too), then

This motel has undoubtedly been around for quite a long time, but was clean and comfortable. The room was not at all luxurious, but had everything I needed - a small fridge, microwave. One significant problem, in light of the severe California drought - the faucet in the bathtub could NOT be completely shut off, and I would guess at least 10 gallons of water was wasted each day - maybe more.  I mentioned it to the clerk in the office, and he said he was unaware of it.  Wouldn't someone notice when they were cleaning the room?  Seems like it!

My girlfriend and myself stayed here around mid/late October and had booked the queen room. We arrived via Amtrak and walked to the motel. The walk takes about 15/20minutes but it's uphill all the way so you might want to take a taxi. Especially if it's warm weather! When we arrived we checked in right away and dropped our things off in our room. The room is very spacious, it has a small table with high chairs for you to have breakfast at or perhaps use a laptop. The room also has a large tv with cable, air con, a fridge and a microwave. We were both impressed with the size of the room and the amenities. The bathroom is a good size too, although I felt a few improvements could of been made in our bathroom. A bit of touching up with paint and also the bathroom door was quite

We has a wonderful time at The Patriots Motel. Location was excellent, with a short walk to the pier, restaurants etc. We were greeted with a warm welcome and staff were very helpful and friendly. Parking was ample. Our room has everything we needed and was a great size with lots of space if needed. The only downside was we didn't receive very good Wi-Fi. We were in the room right in the corner so furthest away from the office and we had the poorest signal. Walking just out of our room, straight away the signal would be perfect. maybe that is something to look at. Otherwise, highly recommend!

We were given the choice of 3 rooms which allows pets.  The room we chose didn't have towels and only bar of soap.  The bathtub didn't hold water. But the worst part was that the lights were on all night and I couldn't sleep.  The sound of the traffic was also very loud and disturbing.  Then I couldn't even sleep in because guests were outside shouting in a loud voice.

-ridiculously loud motel guests! Talking so loud, banging noises, music noises, up all night, loud slamming of hotel doors & car doors. Loud car alarms, -we couldn't even open windows or blinds to let fresh air in to cool down stuffy room because of the loud hotel guests & the bright porch lights ;( -they have this crappy portable air conditioning unit that didn't work very well at cooling down the room. -bed was old, noisy, uncomfortable spring bed -furniture was cheap & ugly -they only give us 2 small towels  -they didn't even re-hang / set towels when they turned over the room for our second nights stay, they thru towels on the vanity table -not sure how well they cleaned the room, there was trash & dirt under bed ;(?! -bathroom sink was clogged  +location was good, less than

Love it here! My boyfriend and I stayed here back in June. I loved it felt very homey but the feel of us getting away even if we were close to base -_-  We stayed in the suite very nice, close to the beach, and right next to the Bagel Shack. The person who booked the reservation was very reasonable I paid half over the phone and my boyfriend paid the other half when he got there it was a Friday wasn't expecting to get that room but we were able to. We will be back again

i used to stay here back when it was owned by somebody else.   the new owners take great pride in their property !  they are very friendly and very helpful people.   the hotel is older (retro) but extraordinarily well maintained.  its close to lots of great places to eat too.   the manager, Kate, is very nice.

Was In San Clemente to visit a friend. And though I was Born & raised in OC, I'm not familiar with "south county" really. The motel is a couple blocks from the main drag to the Pier. The walk back (all uphill) is interesting. My room #7 I think. Had a nice little breeze going thru. Interesting plaster walls, nice bed/furnishings, big bathroom. All in good repair. No pool, no other amenities. There is outdoor area, off the the left, with chairs and fire-ring. Its right on the El Camino/PCH. and on the other side is the busy I5  whizzing above. I did not hear freeway noise at night. Its a perfectly nice place. Small; less than 12 units. It's  "older" but not run-down.

hotel is on a busy street. but with windows closed can't hear the traffic.  rooms were clean, nice sized room. hotel is old but very nice. no ice machine had to go to grocery store on corner. which was great. bought food and bbq at the hotel. enjoyed our stay.

Hello there. We planed to stay at the Patriots Boutique Motel for 1 night but ended up staying for 2 because we loved San Clemente. This is a great little motel. Our room was very clean, great king size bed, clean white linen, flat TV, fridge, microwave and air conditioner. The hot water was excellent, bathroom very clean with toiletries. If I want to be picky they could replace there blue towels for white ones. Traffic noise from the freeway can be heard, however this really didn't bother us. Great location with restaurants near by. The beach is a few blocks away. Recommended.

This a basic motel very conveniently located within walking distance of great restaurants, shopping, and the pier/beach. The room was very clean, with a surprisingly comfortable bed, nice pillows, and great service. We purchased through Amazon Coupon and received a good bottle of with our check-in, which was a nice touch. If you are comfortable with the basics you will not be disappointed.

I have a pitbull and they didn't shut the door in my face. Very accommodating, clean, and friendly. Location is perfect. Love the bbq/relaxing area. Very cute place. Will stay there again when I'm in that area again.

Summary Heading: Road Trip on the way to Palm Springs
Summary: I loved it here. The staff are great and obviously know the area, they're nice and laid back. It's a nice location for shops and restaurants. Depending on your idea of a walk, it's a nice walk to the beach. However, back is all uphill, which I personally loved, and it's about 2 miles back and forth. Going to the pier and beach is worth it. It looked like maybe parking is tight if you drive down. The rooms have a fridge and microwave, so if you go to the store you have places to keep food. The wifi is pretty good. Alongside the motel there is a fire pit and bbq spot, so it can be sociable if you like. The room is comfy and the decor is simple, but so pleasant without being motel-y.

We were in San Clemente to visit a marine that is stationed at Camp Pendleton. The motel was very conveniently located to the base and lots of shopping and eating opportunities. Loved that we could walk to the gas station and Ralph's. We had room 11 and had plenty of space for the 4 of us in our group. We had no issues with parking our rental vehicle. Another one of the amedities that we took advantage of was the fire pit. It was the perfect place to meet other people that are staying at the hotel and save money by cooking out on their grills.

This property has so much character and is positioned perfectly within the heart of San Clemente, on the beach side of the freeway which divides the town.  We walked to the beach each evening to watch the sunset and grab a cocktail on the pier, it was lovely.  Also walking distance is the main shopping and restaurant strip called Del Mar Avenue, which is quaint and filled with unique small businesses, from clothing boutiques to fancy restaurants, and on Sunday they had a farmers market!  The staff here is exceptional, Kate is the manager and her son Tony works in the evening, both very helpful, friendly and cared about our comfort.  We cant wait to come back to this precious beach town and will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Friendly welcome and whilst plain, clean and comfortable lodgings. As much as possible we like to arrive in a town and park the car at the accommodation and walk from there. The Patriots and it's location is ideal for this purpose

I found myself in San Clemente for work and was fortunate to find the Patriots Motel could accommodate my 2 month stay. I booked the "Suite", next to the office, which has plenty of room, full kitchen, private patio, grill and fire pit.  Any items I requested, Kate and her crew were more than happy to supply; iron and board, small Styrofoam cooler, fan! The bedding was very comfortable with crisp white sheets and duvet, and plenty of pillows.  A large, full size bathroom with a good size vanity cabinet was very convenient for a 2 month stay. Being within walking distance of a full size grocery store was great so I could use the kitchen and not eat out every night. On the nights I did go out for dinner I always walked to the restaurant - so many choices all up and down El Camino

I applaud the management for going all out to try and take and older roadside motel and trying to convert it to a "boutique" style atmosphere. But, I don't think it is possible with the environment. Good value, clean rooms, dog friendly. It is advertised as a Walk To The Beach location, but in reality, unless you are a conditioned athlete, you would be hard pressed. There are better places to stay closer to the beach. I know this for next time

Even though it was close to the Highway and Freeway we didnt hear the noise.  Clean and Quite. Small rooms but close to city and Beaches.  Free coffee in the morning. walking distance to a bagel and coffee house if you prefer.  Ralphs 200 yards.

Just scanning through some of the negative reviews for this motel, I gotta wonder if it's just the luck of the draw of which room you get.  My personal experience had been positive.  I was here about a month ago, and the room was exactly as pictured.  My initial thoughts on the place is that it was probably a so-so motel that the latest owner tried to improve with a few personal touches that make it "better".  The good... Great location.  Friendly staff - they provided me with an ironing board on request.  As mentioned, the room was exactly as pictured.  Soft bed and pillows.  And a gigantic bathroom.  I was also happy they provided a few toiletries including shampoo, conditioner, and liquid soap, since I don't typically expect these from motels.  The bad... Gotta get back to

The Patriots Boutique Motel is a gem to find at the beach. An ideal location for groceries (as stores are only a walk away), the bagel shack next door is wonderful to grab a bite before heading off to stroll the main street shops, or walk the beach.   Having a mini fridge and microwave saves a bunch on the budget and a welcome bonus. While coffee is not in the room, outside of the motel office a fresh pot is brewed and refreshed often in the morning. The room is comfortable, clean, and contains a larger than most bathrooms. The flat screen TV and basic cable kept me aware of the weather and local news, before heading out to the beach. We needed an ironing board and iron, and upon contacting the front desk was brought one. Kudos.  Though I did not have a chance to enjoy the

Dropping son off at Surf Camp, needed a quick one night. CHEAP! As I grabbed a cold Corona at Tequilas, the waitress told me about Patriots. It was a block down $90ish and 1-2 blocks from main drag. I think it was an old Rancho Motel but it was clean, great bedding, huge bathroom. A "beach motel" for sure, but location, views, price. Best deal in town! I'm almost afraid to let this secret out!

Summary Heading: Charming, Great Service, Great Location, WiFi that actually works, Pet Friendly!
Summary: My boyfriend and I have very busy work schedules. We frequently take little "staycations" for a day or two when we have the days to do so. Our requirements for a hotel: pet friendly for our dog who always comes with us, functional wifi access so we can binge watch Netflix or HBOGo, a refrigerator to keep or Trader Joe's haul fresh. This place delivered on all of those. The small complex is very cute, kind of a southwestern/art deco design if that makes any sense. There is a neat little bonfire and BBQ area that is available to all. They even have an area where you can leash your dog with a long slack so they can roam around too. I thought that was a nice consideration for pet owners. The in room refrigerators work really, the beds are comfortable with lots of pillows, and the

After walking out of another motel and then find this place it was a god send. I had been travelling with a friend and we wanted 2 rooms that were comfortable and clean. Let me say this place filled the bill. The manageress was very friendly and helpful and even dropped us off at the railway to save us walking. The motel has this lovely little garden area with a fire pit that is just great to sit at and enjoy a drink and conversation with other travellers. The place has been remodelled and is comfortable and economical which was great for us.

had a wonderful trip to San Clemente, and happy I choose the Patriots Boutique for my accommodation.  Rooms were very large and clean, with new flat screen TV's and a comfortable bed.  Location was wonderful and I was able to walk to the beach, grocery store and restaurants.  Strongly recommend, management was friendly & helpful.

Super convenient walk to the beach. The hotel is very basic but clean. The room came with a fridg and microwave, which was a bonus. The staff was friendly. The outdoor fire pit was a nice touch, cool to meet people. The grill was good for cooking a steak. I'd stay here again.

Simple, clean, 10 min walk to the beach. Surrounded by restaurants, must try bagels shack, biggie burger, lots of pizza place variety of everything. A great getaway. Everything walkable. Cozy town. Variety of food.

My daughter and I booked this room through a Groupon.  Groupon rate had a bottle of wine included, which we did not receive.  We stayed Friday & Saturday night.  We had a very basic room.  The room was fairly large and had a large bathroom.   However, the carpet was filthy dirty and stained more than just a little bit.  Needless to say - shoes on at all times.   Friday night had very few guests and a crazy man across the street screaming at midnight (which in all fairness had nothing to do with the motel, but was a little scary).   Location was great - only a couple of blocks from shopping and about 20 minute walk to the beach.      We found office to be closed more than it was open.   All in all, a very average motel and more than a bit disappointing.

stayed 4 nights recently. Clean room, large bathroom.Can open the windows to catch a breeze if you don't want to use the a/c.Staff very friendly and seemingly new to the business but were very ambitious and eager to please.Very basic room; no telephone; closet was in the bathroom (odd). No window shades just blinds; the only door lock was the one in the door knob (not good). Free parking; free wi-fi; free morning coffee outside the office.No pool or restaurant. Location on main street in SC. Not a close place to the beach unless you don't mind the hill on the way back. Chose the pier beach as you can use Muni Meter for parking in the lot as long as you want; T-Street beach access is only street parking/meters - 25 cents/10 minutes wherever you park. Patriots suited my needs.

Husband and I booked a room here based on location and customer reviews, and were thoroughly pleased in all aspects of our stay.  Owner was on property and was sincerely pleasant and made sure we were well taken care of.  Staff was professional and everyone had a smile on their face anytime we saw them.  They all work hard to maintain the grounds and customer satisfaction, which we noticed throughout our 3 day stay.  Hotel is quaint and charming, simple yet comfortable and for then to have white bedding is quite honest, as you can't hide stains with white... everything was very clean.  Wish the young owner the best for the future, I know he will do well.

Stayed here with my family in august and found the whole experience to be wonderful.  Location is great, staff very helpful and friendly and the rooms were very clean and had everything we needed.  We will be back!

Summary Heading: What customer service should look like
Summary: I have stayed at this motel 4 times in the past year while traveling from northern CA to San Diego.  The same guy Jeb always helps me out, and welcomed me back graciously at the beginning of every stay.  The last time I stayed there I was running waaaaaaaaay late and I called ahead to make sure the room wasn't going to go to someone else.  He thanked me for the call, but assured me that the room would be there waiting for me when I arrived.  I didn't end up getting there until like 11:30pm and he was there working in the front office and got me checked in quickly.  The room was perfect--i think my road weary self was asleep within minutes of putting my head on the pillow.  thank you Patriots!!!

My family and I arrived at the Patriots Motel at check in time and were immediately greeted by the friendly staff and management.   We occupied 2 rooms during our visit and we were very satisfied with the cleanliness of the motel both inside and outside.  Each day of our visit I noticed the staff diligently working to maintain the premises.  The rooms were clean, spacious and the beds were very comfortable.  The large bathrooms were a plus!  We enjoyed meeting the other guests that were vacationing too.  The location is great.  Shopping, dinning and the beach are all within walking distance.  The overall value way exceeded my expectations!  We had a great vacation and will definitely stay at the Patriots Motel the next time we return to San Clemente.

Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a weekend while we were in Orange County and we absolutely loved it. It was very clean and quiet for a motel. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. They are pet friendly and they have an open lot right next door for walking your dog. If you can manage to book the suite, I recommend that you do. It has a barbeque and fire pit in a small courtyard right outside of it. All in all, this was a great place to stay, we can't wait to go back!

I‚Äôve read the previous feedback and do not believe that we were in the same place; our experience was so far from those described.   Upon arrival we eventually managed to get a reply to the bell, saw a member of staff for about 2 minutes and that was the last time we saw anyone so can‚Äôt comment on the staff.  The room was pretty bare, poorly maintained and grubby.  It smelt of a weird chemical air freshener which we left on as it was used to overpower the odour of dog. The original air con unit was broken but still there & a portable one stood in the room with the intake hose out through the bit of wood which replaced a window, this meant the room was light & noisy too as the broken blinds didn‚Äôt shut properly.  The room next door seemed to be occupied by a large family sitting

From the name and the pictures I expected more of a "boutique" motel.  There is nothing special about the Patriot.  It is a very ordinary 50's/60's mom & pop style motel, in a great location with very friendly, helpful and accommodating staff. It is clean with some updated fixtures, but the air-conditioning didn't work and the refrigerator was inadequate for my needs.  The pictures on the website show a full sized refrigerator but I was told that is in the motel's only suite.  The room we stayed in didn't look anything like the pictures on the websites.  There was no place to sit, other than one straight back wooden chair or the bed. This is dog friendly motel, but there is no place outdoors on the property to relax and sit with your dog. There was no place to sit and enjoy the
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor.  You stayed in a pet friendly room, and because they are pet friendly, we kept the rooms pretty basic, with just a flat screen TV, pillow-top mattresses, end tables, a dresser, fridge & microwave and free WiFi service.  Our other rooms which aren't pet friendly, are a bit more decorated and furnished.  As far as the full refrigerator goes, that is only available in our suite, which comes with a full kitchen with stove/oven, sink, and private patio area with BBQ, fire-pit and patio furniture.  The rest of the rooms have smaller refrigerators and microwaves.  If you decide to come back in the future, without your pet, we can put you in one of our more upgraded rooms!  Thank you again.  Jed

Summary: Flew into John Wayne Airport and headed down to San Clemente for a weekend trip.  We rented the suite which came with the private patio up front and really enjoyed it!  We had a BBQ and a fire, listened to some music and had a few drinks - great space.  The room was very clean and the property has a great location, with a grocery store a block away, the beach a 10 minute walk across the street, and the main strip where all the restaurants and shopping is was a 5 minute walk as well.  We booked directly through their website so we got a free breakfast at the Bagel Shack, which is located next store and has great bagels and coffee.  It was a great trip and we will be back for sure!

We stayed at the Patriots Motel in early June.  We were spending some time with our family for a few days.  The motel is very well situated and a 20 minute walk from the beach.  I would describe the motel as basic but clean.  The manager is a very helpful and cheery person who really does care about his customers.    The motel is going through some remodelling and during our stay there was a bit of work going on which at times felt like we were living on a construction site.  This unfortunately made our stay a bit frustrating as we had a small baby who struggled to fall asleep with the noise.  I say this not to portray the motel in a negative light, quite the opposite in fact.  When we were checking out we mentioned these issues with the manager and he apologised for this

My husband and I stayed here one night last August on a stop on a road trip. We happened to try and find a room during a town festival so all places were booked solid. The location was good and we were grateful we were next door to some shops and very close to the beach. The staff were excellent and very friendly. However the room we had was showing its age and definitely lacking in ways. The bathroom was clean but definitely in poor condition. The air conditioning was a portable unit that was in the bathroom and couldn't reach to the bedroom. And I made the mistake of walking on the carpet barefoot which turned my feet black. I dont think any cleaning could save it. And being unfamiliar with the area, I cannot comment on the price but $120 for one night seemed excessive.
Manager Response: Hello - Thanks for the review.  We are actually new owners who took over the place last July, so you must have stayed with us when we first took over.  Since your stay, we have completely remodeled the rooms, replacing all carpet and vinyl flooring, bringing in brand new king pillow-top mattresses, flat screen TV's, microwaves and fridges.  We have all new vanities and light fixtures and have added WiFi internet connection, which is free for our guests.  As you know, we are in a great downtown location, where you can walk to the beach and all the shops and restaurants on Avenida Del Mar.  Also new since your stay, is the new Ralphs grocery store, which just opened up down the street, walking distance... so for nights you don't feel like going out, you can make dinner in your room or snack and watch a movie.  We are a great value stay!   Hopefully you can come visit us again and see what we've done with the place!  Jed

Summary: Went on a one night get away and boy was I so happy I did!  Jed has done an amazing job with this motel!  the rooms are so incredibly cute and nicely redone!  Location could not be better, friendly staff, I won't stay anywhere else!  :)

Staff are kind and friendly. Pet rooms very clean and well furnished. 'Beachy" feel all around. Fabulous freshly baked bagel shop right next door. Close to Del Mar street for a walk that takes you all the way down to the beach and on to the Pier for a bowl of amazing chowder at the Fishermans Warf Restaurant. Wonderful little beach motel.

If you do your research and know you won't be staying at the Hyatt then this is a great find.  Good rate, great location and very helpful staff.  The rooms are plain but clean.  We were in San Clemente to spend time outside, not sit in the room so it was perfect for us.  Lots of bars and restaurants very close.  Beach 10 min walk and you must come up hill to get back to hotel.  It's and old school motel that makes for a good place to rest your head.

Took a one-night getaway up the coast to San Clemente April 20th. This place was great for that. It's clean and served it's purpose. Front desk girl was very sweet and had good recomendation for dinner within walking distance. (South of Nick's is a must!) The bed was not comfy, and pillows were flat. The "air conditioning" unit was just a fan, so it got a little stuffy, so if it was any hotter, would of been very uncomfortable.

Summary Heading: Amazing location and a great staff
Summary: My fianc√© and I stayed there this weekend and fully enjoyed our experience.  The location is great...five minute walk to downtown and ten to fifteen minute walk to the beach.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  We highly recommend this hotel and hope you enjoy your experience as much as we did.  FYI get breakfast at antoines right across the street!

What a beautifully quaint place to stay!!! From my first call to my tenth call, (yes, ten times lol) Jed took care of me the whole way through. He didnt even get offended when I asked him "Jed, be honest with me, I can take it, is this place a dive?" He took it like a champ and responded honestly! Its an older motel that he has been renovating step by step...And he was 100% correct, the motel is perfectly matched to the rest of San Clemente. Its old world charm meets a bit of modern day technology. The customer service can speak volumes for any place. From the beginning of our weeks stay, to the end, Jed and his staff were MORE than accommodating. This includes, name change, room change, addition and cancels of rooms (family wedding), to bringing us blankets and pillows late in

We just returned from a one night stay at the Patriots. We booked last minute and were able to get a room at a reasonable rate.  The owner was very friendly and helpful.  The location is excellent and you can walk to most anything. Wifi is free and very good, the beds were super comfy and you can park right in front of your room.  There is a refrigerator, microwave and flat screen TV.  If you want to go to the beach you will need a vehicle.  Our room was pretty basic, no iron or hairdryer and a suitcase stand would have been nice. I know several rooms have been remodeled and I don't think ours was one of them.  Overall, this property has great potential and I hope it continues to improve.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit a review on TripAdvisor!  It was nice to have you visit us and I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.  We are constantly making improvements, so hopefully on your next visit we will have the luggage rack for you :)  As far as the hair dryer and iron, we do have those available at the front desk for guest use.  Look forward to your next visit!  Jed

Summary: My friend and I had a great time staying at the Patriots. It was like staying at a friend's house--the staff was super courteous when we arrived, we had absolutely no problems, and the room was perfect!  When we got there, the staff was waiting for us--seriously like we were family! I think one of them even said "Good, you're here!" (or at least that's my recollection!) Parking was a breeze--we were able to park right next to our room, so the car was in full view all the time. What's more is it was within EASY walking distance of everything--restaurants, shops, and bars (my friend & I were on a dive bar mission--totally accomplished). AND the price was way better than anyone else.  Bottom line: If you're looking for a unique (not chain hotel), affordable, and charming place to

What a wonderful weekend getaway spot!  The view is absolutely beautiful, overlooking the sparkling ocean. Upon arrival my fianc√© and I were greeted with a warm welcoming staff that promptly showed us our room.   Our room was the perfect size, with a large bathroom!  The shower temperature and pressure was amazing (not like those corporate hotels where the water is like a dripping faucet) The location is great for walking to all of the cute shops and restaurants.  After a day full of the beach and shopping we headed back to the room looking forward to a relaxing night.  The owners of the Patriots' Motel were nice enough to invite us to BBQ with them, we grilled dinner and then later on made smores all night.  After a wonderful evening with the owners we quickly fell asleep once

Summary Heading: Charming place, was great for our one night stay.
Summary: My family and I drove up from San Diego to visit the beaches and pier in San Clamente for the day, we needed a room to stay for one night. We did a ton of searches online but opted to find something when we got there, after driving forever and checking on the various hotels/motels on the beach which costs a startling 200+ for ONE night. We decided to stay in town, we found the Patriots motel and checked out the room with two beds, almost two rooms, (the second bed is in an alcove) for $100 for the night (we had four people).  The price is a little high but considering where we were and what others were charging it was reasonable. The beds are new, no bed bugs (first thing we checked on before we even looked at the rest of the room), carpets are soft and clean (you can actually

Summary Heading: Could not ask for a better location or better staff!!!
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay. We enjoyed its location, the staff and our bed was very comfortable. The room we stayed in was perfect and a little courtyard attached with a BBQ area. We ate like kings two nights in a row!!! When we needed anything they brought it to our room immediately. We would love to stay here again.
Manager Response: We are glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!  Thank you,  Jed Tarr
